description:
Job description

OPERATIONS ASSISTANT POSITION | Licensed Reusable Bag Importer with Disney, Marvel, and more (Los Angeles)

Legacy Licensing Partners, LP is seeking an operations assistant to help with inbound / outbound logistics responsibilities, compliance and operational tasks.

About Legacy

Legacy Licensing Partners is a leading design and distribution company of licensed and private reusable bags to retail channels in the US and Canada. Legacy specializes in partnering with the most widely recognized movie studios to create sustainable products at an incredible value. We are seeking an organized operations assistant who is skilled in multitasking and who is excited to join this amazing company!

Based in Downtown Los Angeles, our products are available nationwide in retailers such as Dollar Tree, 99 Cents Only, Kroger, Albertsons, Burlington and many other retailers.

Position Overview

Legacy Licensing Partners, LP is seeking an operations assistant to oversee studio compliance, inventory, quality control, customer service, logistical transportation and other operational tasks. We are looking for an organized and dependable individual who is willing to work full time, in office.

Responsibilities

· Lead and coordinate the activities of inbound and outbound logistics

· Oversee the compliance process between the movie studio and the manufacturing facilities

· Review vendor deliveries, quality issues, inventories and lead-times

· Report on shipping schedules

· Schedule and track inbound and outgoing shipments

· Ensure products are delivered to their locations in a timely manner as per clients’ criteria

· Assess and recommend ideal shipping methods, routing or carriers to meet necessary parameters, specifications and costs

· Negotiate rates with carrier

Education, Experience, Skills

· B.A. or B.S. preferred

· 3+ years in logistics or operations, preferably with an importer

· Excels in both collaborative and independent projects

· Ability to manage multiple projects and absorb and apply constructive criticism from peers and client

· Excellent written and oral communication skills

· Experience in the consumer goods industry and/or licensed products preferred

· Able to meet tight deadlines and self-manage projects

· Fluent in Microsoft Office (Excel and Word) and Google Suite

· Proficient in Quickbooks

· Ability to speak Spanish preferred

Business Hours

Monday through Friday, 8am to 5pm. Schedules can vary based on deadlines and projects. This is an in-office position.

Salary Rate

DOE (Depending on Experience)

**Resumes only, no phone calls please**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $40,000.00 - $60,000.00 per year

Schedule:

  • Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person
